author: Seong P.

description:
I'm coming back here agian. THe location is so-so (difficult to find parking) but the food was fantastic. Not very spicy, so we need to ask for more next time. Very flavorful though. The pad thai was tasty. The "calumari salad" appetizer was interesting and fun. But I'm also on a squid kick these days it seems. I'm coming back to try out some more. 

Beautiful art on the walls. Very cozy feeling.
author: Benjamin T.

description:
I just found a Manivanh receipt in my wallet and had to Yelp to remember what the hell a Manivanh was. Now I remember: really good Thai food that didn't cost a lot of money.

As I remember, which might be wrong, me and a friend each had an app, an entree, and a beverage. I think I had an iced coffee thing. She probably had beer. My receipt says $31, which ain't bad.

I remember the food was surprisingly good, and we both really liked it. I drink a lot, so this is about as specific as 3-month-old memories get. 

Recommended.
author: That Was A Good Drum Break ..

description:
I'm going to make it short and sweet. For the price, this restaurant is a good find. Very very veeeery good yellow curry dishes. I use to walk here every so often with my man, gorge myself, have  few beers, then end up with a bill for two under $40. Pretty darn good deal if you ask me!

The decor could use a little upgrade and they are not open on Sundays which is the best time to go out to eat, but other than that I say stop on by!
author: Ali K.

description:
I love this place. I've been many times to eat in or take-out. Take-out portions are large and a great value for the price. Consistently above average thai food, and very vegetarian friendly.

Good, friendly service, and family-run. They're open pretty late on weeknights too.

Comfortable, clean, quiet and stylish interior is fine for a quiet evening with my girlfriend, or a large group (they have a separate group dining room).

Updating with an additional star for their speedy service, too!
author: Raduga N.

description:
I used to work around the corner from Manivanh and I was always happy when I could convince my co workers to spend a little more than the usual $6 or so for lunch. It's not a cheap lunch joint. The decor is so-so (carvings hung on the walls and a couple of other items, but generally it's just a room with some tables in it) but that's no the point. The point is that the food is very good. It's my favorite Thai restaurant in the city. Better than Thai House Express (except for the hours). Better than Khun Phoa, which is now gone. I love this place and I'm sad that it's so far from where I live now, cuz I hardly go there anymore, except as a treat.
Only 4 stars because the decor and service are decent but not great. This is not a schwanky date destination nor a place to have stylish wait staff falling all over you. It's all about the food!
author: Jamie F.

description:
came in here unplanned because we were just walking around the area.  the place is sort of dark and gave me that "i'm not sure what's going on" feeling.  the menu had a nice and but not crazy extensive selection.  i did notice my favorite pad see ew was not on the menu. :(  i can't remember what i ate, but it was a rice dish with pork, basil and some chili sauce.  honestly, it wasn't all that great.  the sauce was pretty much siracha/sambal mixed in, so more salty than spicy in my opinion.

will i ever come back? probably not.  there's better thai food out there.
author: Sally T.

description: The broccoli + tofu pad thai, ordered "spicy," was served with an orange wedge and a lot of dark sauce. It had a complex smoky, charred flavor that was different than any other American pad I've tried. I liked it, even though the noodles were slightly al dente. The morsel of Belgian chocolate with the bill tips this spot into "hidden gem" status. Cozy and quiet dinner vibe.
author: Danny T.

description:
Wow wow wow! If you are a vegetarian and a tofu lover, this place is AMAZING.

It's an unassuming little shop in the Mission. I never would have gone in if my friend hadn't raved to me about it. We were a group of five, and were seated immediately (on a Saturday night!). Three of us were vegetarians, and the carnivores were kind enough to let us order an all-veggie meal.

We got pretty much everything with tofu... You can order your tofu steamed or fried. Order the fried! It was the most delicious tofu I have ever placed in my mouth. And I am not one for superlatives (especially when it comes to food). But wow. Lemony and crisp and juicy...

This place deserves much more buzz than it gets. Maybe it's the whole location thing. Move it to Valencia street and there would be lines out the door, no doubt.
author: Trey F.

description:
mehhhh.. its OK.  My brother thought it would be good, but I didnt think it was that great.  I thought the pad thai was a little salty.  My silver noodles were also a little on the salty side.  Onions were also too raw.  

the only part I liked was the peanut sauce with the fried tofu.  They do give you a lot of fried tofu.
author: Janet S.

description:
We were all pumped up to go try this place because it's really close and we thought "This is going to be awesome to have a great Thai place close by!"  But now I feel ethically bound to warn other so they won't go have a pretty much awful meal like we did tonight after reading and foolishly trusting the positive reviews here.  

I'll say up front, that the people who work there are nice, the place is clean looking and the Thai Ice Tea was good, which is the only reason I gave it two stars instead of one. 

But the food, eeack!  First, the vegetables with "chef's special sauce" was bland and the beef looked freezer burned.  The chicken Pad Thai was doused in an orange sugary sause.  Just gross.  My mate was still hungry, so she got the highly recommended (by the waiter, who was, again, very nice) beef salad.  She was so hungry she just ate most of it, but I had a bite of the beef and it was chewy and saturated in the lemon dressing and, ah, not good.  When it was all done, we both had a greasy taste in our mouths.  

What a disappointment.  I'm sorry to say, it was so bad I'm not interested in giving it another chance, which I will normally do with places I'm not happy with on a first try.  I'm not a huge fan of Grand Pu Bah at the foot of Potrero because it's kind of wannabe hip, not to mention pricy, but it is hands down better than this place.
author: Justen W.

description:
So, this is my first review since moving to SF. 
Being that I have travelled extensively to Southeast Asia, I am always a bit suspicious of such food back here in the states. How authentic or fresh or compromised for the American palate is this going to be?

Manivahn is actually in my neighborhood--24th Street, in the Mission. I promise to not be biased. In fact, I move around quite a bit in the city to find good Thai food and it is mostly at least good. Sometimes the flavors are a bit contrived and the different dishes muddle together after a few bites.

Not so with Manivanh!  This is my fourth time dining there, so I have a more complete picture of both their menu and consistency. 
This is the real deal. Love the Larb Ta Hu (a salad with Tofu, mint, orange slices, etc)---light and well-balanced and a great way to wake up the palate.

Also the Plaa pad ma kur (terrible Thai on that one)--basically a lightly breaded and sauteed rock cod in a light, yet flavorful sauce. Delicious and delicate and a crowd pleaser. 

Between those and the eggplant & chiles in a special chef's sauce, the perfectly-executed sticky rice and the almond-oil tea, I am quite impressed each time.

The only gripe is the lack of music in the place. Now, I am very loquacious so I am not one to fear the awkward silence that can happen on dates and so forth, but I do enjoy some aural ambiance. Need to discuss that with staff on next visit.

Oh, almost forgot to mention the lovely wall art. Deep-carved scenes of the Ramayana and Floating Markets as well as Apsaras really lend to authenticity.

Just get some music in there and it'll make this one a FIVE STAR!!!
author: Carmine R.

description:
the food here is delicious, and most importantly, cheap! (i never spend more than $10 for myself, and I always have food left over) 
I work about 2 blocks away and i order take out from manivanh on a regular basis. the people who work there are always friendly. everytime i have been there to get lunch take out the place has been surprisingly empty, considering its one of the only thai places in the neighborhood thats open for lunch. might have something to do with the fact that its in the Mission, surrounded by taquerias...
author: Maureen B.

description:
If you happen to end up in the SFGH emergency room, head on over to Manivanh during your 8 hour wait to see a doctor.

This place was so yummy and reasonable. I wish I lived closer so I could get take out every week.
author: Becks A.

description:
MMMMmmmmmm pad thai.  Best I've had in the city and the take-out service was quick quick quick! 

I wasn't much a fan of the fried tofu app.  Bleh and bland.  Skip and order two pad thais.
author: Jill K.

description:
I love working right down the street from these folks - their pad-ma-kur with tofu is the perfect antidote to a crappy day on the job.

And I must admit that one of THE saddest moments I can remember was the day when I was craving said eggplant-and-tofu-laden dish only to arrive at their door and find that they were closed for a holiday.  Oh, the humanity.
author: Dani B.

description:
I personally love thai food but getting my boyfriend to try or order any kind of asian food is super hard. I attribute this to my chinese neighbors who cook/boil turtle, chicken feet, and squid. Regularly, the smells of mystery meat woft into our house through cracks in the doors which is enough to make you lose your appetite.

So...when I suggested we try this place I was more than surprised to hear my boyfriend say " Sure." The restaurant is small but cozy and the service was great. We ordered the Por-piah-pak, vegetarian spring rolls to start out with and they were really good with a good chili sweet sauce to dip them into. I ordered the pad thai with tofu which was tasty! The tofu was lightly fried not OVER fried like some places do and I loved the bed of fresh bean sprouts. The boyfriend ordered Pad-gra-prao which was tofu with chilis, mushrooms , fresh basil and a spicy sauce. Yum yum double yum! 
Overall, this place is very affordable and there is enough food for 2 if you order one dish. My only dissapointment is they didnt have sticky rice. I WILL go back again! Its the best thai food i've had in the city so far AND my picky boyfriend liked it which is saying a lot!
author: Amy A.

description: Good Thai place with supposedly great Pad Thai.
author: Jim J.

description:
Working at SFGH, there's only so many options for lunch. Manivanh Thai is definitely always at the top of my list!
The food is great, perfect portions and reasonably priced. You can't go wrong with the traditional Pad Thai, but you definitely have to try the green curry (I love eggplant and this is an awesome way to have it) that comes with rice. 
The service is always great too! Even if you order out, they will serve you complimentary water while you wait, which is never too long.
author: Dee D.

description:
I agree that it is odd to get a spicy pad thai, but I will use this info to my advantage in the future. 

This place is only 4 blocks away form me, so I am always ordering takeout on a whim. It's also a nice dine in for the evening, but then my boyfriend is bound to order way too much food (plus booze).

I'm adding this review due to illness: relieved, not caused by this place. I've been ill all day and could not think of one thing I could stand to eat. Everything I could imagine made me nauseous just to think about.

Then I remembered the gang-jae. I would recommend it to anyone, vegetarian, with general body malaise, or otherwise hungry. It has gluten and tofu, plus coconut and chili to heal your ills.

The pad thai is very good-well, I've never NOT liked anything there, but that gang-jae is the best!
author: dodie L.

description:
Calamari salad, any soup, shrimp pad thai, seafood. Its all good. 

CLG down the street has nothing on this paper dragon. 

Rahhhhhh ! !!!
author: Joe G.

description:
Visiting my gerl Alena at San Francisco General Hospital and she took me to Manivanh for lunch..

Hands down the best Pad Thai i've ever had.. Pure perfection..  Perfect combination of tartness, and sweetness.. You can only judge a Thai restaurant by its Pad Thai..

A lil pricey for the Mission, but well worth it..
author: Carlo M.

description:
This is my favorite Thai restaurant in SF! I tried it because of the high reviews here on Yelp. Everyone is right, they are good and very reasonably priced. The portions are reasonably sized and perfectly seasoned. 

Specifically, I like to go to Thai restaurants and try the Pad Thai. This restaurant had the best flavor pad Thai. My second favorite is Marnee Thai in the sunset. They also have a few creativ e

Get off at the 24th Street BART and walk or catch the bus. It's a small place but the decoration is tasteful. I love this place!
author: David A.

description:
This place is around the block from my house and I've been meaning to eat here for about 2-3 months. I have to say, they have quite the selection...I got tofu with lemongrass..it would have been nice if it was a little more saucy, but the taste was there. The pad thai I go to go for my pop-tart lovin' buddy - had a few bites it was delicious. Not dry and with great flavor. I had ordered with my meal, but asked for it 'to-go' and the waiter brought it out with our check - smart.

reheat still tasted wonderful - red curry with coconut milk

update:

this place gets 5 stars because their food is just always good. I crave it now. one of the best thai restaurants, period.
author: Anita C.

description:
One more reason to never have to leave the 'hood.  Balanced flavors, great duck dish and suuuper tasty pad thai.

May be upgraded to five stars after a few more dinner selections.

Until then...falling in love with the 'hood yet again!
author: Sandy K.

description:
If you had told me, I lived within two blocks of this place yesterday morning I would not have believed you.

Luckily you didn't, because I am pretty sure I would have made an ass of myself, telling you to shut up.

This place will probably be my new Thai Food go to, and not only for the location.

The Pad Thai wasn't greasy, and had a good amount of tofu/prawns/sprouts/peanut crumbs.  

The Tom Kah Gai soup was the best version of this soup that I have ever had.

The Prawn and Eggplant curry was probably my favorite though.

When I went home and told my roommates, they didn't believe me.  

Assholes.
author: Adam C.

description: This little family-owned restaurant is a gem in the Mission. It's consistently great, and the service is good, too. Food is fresh, authentic, and aromatic. Highly recommended.
author: elle s.

description: shrimp pad thai or shrimp green curry my fav,call ahead to place order if dinning in for lunch otherwise u will be late back from lunch break.Overall good food ,i come in atleast every other month.
author: Nina B.

description: Not good Thai food. Duck red curry was bland and had no curry flavor (tasted watered down); papaya salad was flavorless; pad Thai was bland and had very little beef. I don't recommend this restaurant.
author: Joseph Y.

description: It's probably one of the few Thai food places in the Mission Dist. so I decided to give it a shot.  The place is normally not busy at all and the interior has a nice cozy feel to it.  I got the minced basil chicken, which the cashier recommended.  It's was okay, but too oily.  I've had lots of better Thai food in the bay area, but I guess it will do since it's in the Mission.
author: Ricky M.

description:
I'll keep it simple:

Food - Tasty, but nothing special. Portions were relatively small - 3 stars

Service - Very friendly and attentive - 4 stars

Price - On the small side for a $9 bowl of curry. There's a $12 minimum per person for dinner. I know that's not unreasonable, but when there's so many other good Thai restaurants for less, it's something to think about - 3 stars
author: Todd W.

description:
I live in the neighborhood and love this place.  When you want a quick Thai fix, this place does the trick.  I believe it's family-owned and operated.  The pad thai is delish. 

Also, if you have time to eat in, the decor is very traditional Thai and it super cozy.
author: Ames P.

description: This place needs a remodel for sure, but the food is pretty darn good for a Thai place at its price point. Yelp overall has it ranked lower than Chili Cha Cha but after eating the same thing (Tom Yum soup) at both places in a week, I can say there is absolutely no comparison. Manivanh's was fresh vegetables and flavorful broth with lots of spices, including fresh cilantro, floating around. Chili Cha Cha's was chili oil, tofu that had been fried hours ago and dumped in, and some sad looking vegetable-like things. So I'm giving it 4 stars, and telling you, if you're on 24th with a hankering for Thai, the choice is clear.
author: Cameron S.

description: We got take out here one night.  We got I think Panang Curry and Pad See-ew, if I remember correctly.  The curry was nothing special, but it was curry, so it was good in that respect.  The Pad See Ew was pretty middle of the road as well.  Not tons of flavor in either dish.  It's close by and reasonably priced, so it's good for a take-out fix, but I wasn't too impressed.  Pretty middle of the road.
author: Sean H.

description: ...have been back several (many?) times since finding this place...always fresh and delicious...was in there again saturday 8-14...another great meal...and the stafff are friendly and don't hate their jobs...how refrshing is that?...will go back often as i can...
author: Bob L.

description: This is average Thai food...closest place to my house so I will definitely have it again.  When we ate there the service was horrible; we've only had it to go since then.  Food was average for thai, so I think 3 stars is just about right.
author: GranolaGorilla Z.

description: Manivanh offers average to slightly above average Thai food.   The service is usually attentive, the ambiance is comforting, and the number of vegetarian options is definitely a plus.  The prices tend to run a little on the high side.  Sometimes I come here for the Thai ice tea alone - absolutely scrumptious.
author: Who Knows N.

description: The aroma of pungent garlic  coming from this restaurant caught my attention recently. My first sign of trouble here, however, came when asking for a to go menu last week. The girl working the counter was anything but friendly when handing one over and answering questions. Today, we arrived at the restaurant at 11AM and were kept waiting until the same rude young lady showed up. I joked that she was late, she insisted they were not (cook was opening gate), and asked us to wait a few more minutes for them to set up. No apology, no explanation. I wish I could tell you whether the food here is good or not, but we did not even get that far. My advice to the owners is to hire new staff immediately.
author: Kenny G.

description: I can't believe it took me so long to go to this place, which is possibly the closest Thai restaurant city to me. It was good, not remarkable. My vegetarian entree was pretty fish-saucy.
author: Amy E.

description:
I really was hoping this would be my new favorite Thai restaurant, but unfortunately I can only give it two stars.  Went here for New Year's dinner.  Ordered the pad thai, pork praram, and a duck dish.  The pad thai was just mediocre. I've had better pad thai at little hole-in-the-wall thai places. Pork praram was alright, but not good enough to go back for.  The duck was mostly fat as I expected it might be and also had way too much diced ginger, perhaps to distract you from the lack of meat? 

But I have to say the service was very good. They didn't smother us nor neglect us, so there was a nice balance there. We also stayed and lingered at our table while finishing our Sing-has after we paid and they didn't seem to mind at all.  No one was waiting for our table anyway. I probably won't go back unless I'm in the mission and not able to stomach yet another taco or burrito.
author: L. Renee D.

description:
Ode to Manivanh:
(Zoolander style)

Your thai iced tea was perfect.
So creamy and sweet
like a river of caramel
but not as gooey
or thick

Your vegetarian menu is copious.
The tofu was fried so crispy and soft
how could it be both
i wondered?
but it was.
and the dish was sprinkled with baby corns 
with mushroom friends nearby.

And the calamari and prawns were tantalizing.
bathed with a spicy gingery sauce,
my taste buds were dancing
happily towards the calamari
not away, as many times they are.

When we got the check
we were pleased
So inexpensive 
for such nice food
that left our taste buds tantalized
and our wallets half filled
and our hearts content,
at least with the meal.
author: bloopie s.

description: Their Pad Thai was good, but I've had better.  I'd patronize this place more if I were nearby.  Still, Manivanh's a definite asset to the area; I could see why it's such a big hit with the SFGH staff.  Worth the trek across town?  Probably not.  More than anything, I enjoyed the milk chocolate pieces that came at the end of our meal, as opposed to those mints that I never end up eating.
author: Marsha Z.

description: this is a phenomenol place food is delicious pad thiaan yellow curry is my favorite here nice service as well really great place to go if ur near mission or petrero hands down best pad thai authentic taste i love it
author: DRASTIK P.

description: Read great reviews and finally checked this place out.... Best Thai food I've had in SF (or ever for that matter).... Fast service, fresh and flavorful.....Nice and spicy too.    I'll be back for sure.
author: Mike S.

description: Best Pad Thai I've had in the Mission district by a long shot. This includes Pad Thai (which could be construed as Noe Valley), OLG and others. The decor is nice enough and the service was great (but I was one of two people, so it should have been).
author: Gabe M.

description:
everytime i'm having thai food, i find myself comparing it manivanh! unfortunately all the others never live up to that expectation and i'm rarely in the city anymore so i'll have to settle until then...

every dish i've tried thus far has been absolutely delicious. however, one word... duck salad! everytime i think of this dish i swear my mouth begins to water. it's definitely a favorite and everyone we've recommended it to seems to love it as well.

the atmosphere is cozy and quaint. the best part would have to be the service here which is always wonderful! consistently attentive and super sweet!
author: Julia C.

description: Some of their stuff here is okay but they are really annoying with the onions.  They put onions in everything!  Once I ordered something that didn't list onions in the ingredients and guess what... it came with onions!  Now I love onions but too much is just too much.  Also they seem to let junkies off the street come in to ask everyone for Methadone money... sigh.
author: Fredricko B.

description: Pad Thai Pad Thai Pad Thai Pad Thai Pad Thai . . . what's that?  Manivanh?  But I'm a Pad Thai loyalist!!  Pad Thai has earned my eternal undying trust and allegiance!  Pad Thai's delicious!  Pad Thai delivers!  Pad Thai . . . hey, that's some damn tasty yellow chicken curry.  What was I saying?  Oh yes . . . Pad Thai rocks!  Pad Thai . . . waitaminit, that tom yung goong is off the hook!  What was I . . . holy hell, get a load of this - prawns, scallops, zucchini and mushrooms sauteed in garlic-pepper sauce!  Move over!  Pad-gra-prao?  Don't mind if I do!
author: Jefferson C.

description:
i get take out from here at least once a week and about once a month i dine in.  by now, the staff know my voice and name and, automatically know i will at least be ordering the #70 with rice.  i never get anything but the #70, with rice, for a main entree.  i have tried most of the veggie stuff and nothing beats the #70.  the tofu is fried perfectly and the sauce is filled with garlic and spice.  you won't get many veggies in this dish - just bamboo, lots of onions, and red/green peppers.

i think the pad thai jae (#74), which geoffrey always gets, is also good.  and, when we dine in, we typically get an order of the fried veggie spring rolls.  they are standard but enjoyable. also, when you eat in they give you a few pieces of chocolate to end your meal.

if you live near 24th and bryant and you haven't eaten here you are missing out.
author: Kristie P.

description:
Cheap, amazingly tasty and quite honestly the best pad thai my friends and I have ever had.  Also, they have gluten and lots of vegetarian/vegan options.  Service is awesome and HIGHly amusing.  Not to mention attentive.  Also, they'll substitute pretty much anything -- in my case, eggplant.  Mmm.

Manivanh is made of win.
author: Matthew H.

description:
Close to home. Great food. Love that the guy treats me like an old drinking pal and I've only been going there for the past two months (granted I'm usually there once a week).

Minus one star because....

1. They manage to not be open when I really have a craving (aka Sunday nights). 
2. You can say no spice five times when you order and it'll usually come out spicy.
author: H.S. G.

description: If you're in this hood and craving the thai stuff, go here. The pad thai is excellent and yes, they charge for rice but the rice is so fluffy and perfectly cooked! The leftovers reheated really well. Everything tasted truly authentic and the thai iced tea was ever so delicious! Service was kind of slow, but friendly. Will definitely make this my go-to place for neighborhood thai treats.
author: Jeannie C.

description: I think this is one of the best Thai restaurants in the city.  I've never had anything I didn't like, and most of the time I would say the food was simply superb.
author: Judy B.

description: A quiet little restaurant in a corner of the Mission.  The hours are unexpectedly short, and they are occasionally randomly closed.  But the food is pretty good, and not too expensive.  The food is vegan friendly.  I recommend getting the dish with the seitan in it.
author: Douglas P.

description: Delicious food, fine service, comfortable atmosphere. Manivanh is a solid choice when you find yourself in the mission craving thai food. I've been here countless times -- but note it's a mere block from my house, I'd probably not go as much if I had to travel a distance. But as it stands, it's probably the place I eat most at right now because it's consistently satisfying (mmm, tom ka gai on a rainy day. Maybe I'll go there tonight.)
author: Mella P.

description: This was for dinner on a staurday night, lunch may be different. They got my order worng. I wanted Pad thai with no tofu.  The ditched the shrimp but ket the tofu. I did'nt send it back, whatever. There's like one waiter, so dont be in a rush. It's decent thai, but more traditional thai than fancypants new wave type of thai.
author: Greg H.

description: Very decent Thai food. A nice change of pace from all the taquerias if you're in the 24th Street area of the Mission. Curry vegetable and prawn dishes are delicious.  Place is pretty inexpensive, too.  If you're down by SFGH, it's a good place to eat. Clean and quiet.
author: Allyson V.

description: maybe it is an "off-day" for the chef today.  I ordered a red curry (with prawns) take-out.  they gave tons and tons and tons of rice and a tiny little carton of curry.  to my surprise though, there was like 4-5 prawns in there (it's not that i can't count, i was just not really paying attention).  the curry must have been watered down or something because it was super super bland.  i thought i was dousing my rice with water.  also, a tiny cup of curry & rice cost $9.75 (after tax).  For me, that's just a little too high.  Maybe if this place was only $6/$7 would i give this place another try, but as far now, i think i'll stay away.
author: H. L.

description: It is really hard to mess up vegetarian pad kee mao but this place managed it somehow. Worst Thai food i have had in a while, though actually a week ago i had even worse thai food on larkin and leavenworth somehow. Anyhow, i had been warned against this place before and i finally said i should try for myself and i wish i didnt.. "pad thai" on mission is so much better..
author: jake l.

description: This place is a good find in an area largely devoid of good Thai food.  The staff is very friendly.  The Tom Kah Gai soup is very good.  The pad thai is passable.  The spicy eggplant with chicken is good until you pay closer attention to the chicken - and that is my problem with this place.  The chicken is not recognizable as such.  It resembles no chicken I've ever eaten before.  I'd go back, but I'd stay vegetarian.  The meat seems sketchy to me.
author: Kiki V.

description: Kinda surprised at the high ratings here. We tried this place a while ago and it was solid but nothing special at all. I would go back if I found myself in the Mission with a jones for some Thai, but would not go out of my way to go here again. Good but very ordinary.
author: Brian H.

description:
update:  i'd like to add one more star for customer service.  there was confusion about my order tonight (hint: do NOT order takeout from the lunch menu during dinnertime; example: the curry karee is chicken and potatoes at lunch, but there is NO curry karee at dinnertime, but instead a curry karee goong which has NO chicken, but prawns instead).  i went back to the restaurant and they made me a replacement chicken/potato version free of charge, and even gave me a glass of iced water while i waited for it!  plus, there was no attitude, no "well, it's your fault, you ordered stupid, now go eat your prawns!"  it's great when people help you figure out what happened without making you feel like an idiot.

i like their yellow chicken curry cuz it's just chicken and potatoes, but then again i like most yellow curries.  the chicken is kinda fatty and potatoes inconsistently cooked (some harder, some mushy).  don't get the panfried egg noodles- it's basically some broccoli and onions on top of a chunk of ramen noodles.  not very flavorful.
author: Zoe L.

description: Great service, tasty food, nice quiet environment, reasonable prices, yes this place is a little hidden treasure in the abundance of Mission eats. I had the eggplant/vegetable dish with rice and was very happy with it. I really like this place for the tranquility, very soothing and especially perfect if you're in the mood for a chill night and don't want to deal with a wait or noise. I can't wait to go back.
author: Swetha G.

description: Picked up takeout last night and was pretty disappointed. How can Thai food be bland?
author: Priya S.

description: I am quite surprised by the number of 4 and 5 star reviews of this place. I had dinner there last night, and it was borderline terrible. It was without a doubt one of the worst Thai dinners I've had in the city. Nothing was fresh, it tasted like a lot of sugar was added to the dishes, and everything was bland. There's just no reason to choose this place with so many other outstanding options in the city.
author: Eater S.

description: Delicious Thai food. When I'm in the Mission and have a need for eggplant, Manivanh is my goto joint. For some reason it's not all that crowded either whenever I go.
author: Donovan W.

description: Not the best thai restaurant...but if you need a fix...definately a good place to go.  Their pad thai is good..chicken satay is ok...and their number 40 (rock cod with string beans) is yummy.
author: Maybelline C.

description:
Yeah, thats right, I'm throwin down 5 stars for my folks down at Manivahn. Nice intimate Mission spot. My family dines here regularly.

This is good Thai food. Fufu snobs may disagree, but what do they know. They can have their saffron, truffle oil version of Thai Food. From the Angel Wings to the Curry, you can't deny that this is good food. Family owned...  good folks.
author: Dan J.

description: Go with the Larb Ped as a starter, it is minced duck salad with chili peppers, red onions, fresh mint, and lemon dressing with a touch of rice powder.  That's a bangin opening to a dinner, for follow-ups the standard thai stuff here is good, it's a solid place to eat, but yeah, larb ped all the way.
author: shawn g.

description: I go here all the time.  The wood carvings on the walls are enough to make this place magical.  The food is suburb, with rice served in ornate tin dishes, and your meal on a plate like it should be.  I've had spicier than their spiciest (ask for as spicy as you can make), but it was still intoxicating, which is what I go for.  Their food is very very good.  I would take business partners here, or visiting friends, or roommates.
author: Ben H.

description: Back in the early 70's, this place was the best of the first crop of Vietnamese restaurants that swept SF after the end of the war in Vietnam -and remained so for many years, until the mid- 80's, when it changed to its present Thai incarnation. The new place took a couple of years to catch up to its  predecessor and continued to be excellent, until 5 years ago, when their kitchen took a dive south - quality wise.  Service and atmosphere are both good, but they can't offset the mediocrity of the food.
author: Victor M.

description: This place really is a hidden little gem in the neighborhood, well, maybe not that hidden since everybody who works at the hospital eats here, and for good reason.  Everything I've tried is delicious, like the eggplant, duck, seafood, red curry chicken, and especially the pad thai.  They use the Vietnamese pho noodles which is chewy in texture the way I like it and the sauce is very good.  My coworkers and I always share a couple of dishes and it's just enough food without making us feel bloated or overly stuffed afterwards, leaving enough room for the delicious fried banana and ice cream dessert.  My only little complaint is that they charge an extra $1.95 for shrimp dishes and only give you like 3 shrimps, but overall this is a great little restaurant and I will keep coming back for the great food.
author: Stewie G.

description: I've been walking in front of this place for one year and a half. I always got the impression of a low quality restaurant, suspicious. Well, good to know that I was wrong. The place is cheap, not so oily/greasy, passed the Pad Thai and Green curry test and on top of that, looks like a preferred lunch-shelter for SFGH people (I am one of those). Honestly, it's been a good surprise, one of those that makes you smile and say "shame on me" for judging places for the way they look.
author: Dario B.

description: One of the better Thai places I've had.  Their pad thai was good, but I can't say it was the best (although, I partially blame this on my sister.  She wanted pineapples in the dish, which throws everything off in my book).  I LOVED the yellow chicken curry.  I'd go back just for that.  Also, the tofu was reallly very good- crispy and yet soft on the inside, even my non-tofu-loving-cousin liked it.  The Thai Iced Tea was very sweet, which means I liked it.  Went on a Thursday at dinner time, and there was no crowd- a nice change...
author: Rohit G.

description: non greasy, totally decent thai food in the mish.  CLG is bad.  really really bad.  so it's nice to have another option close by.  i ordered chicken salad and that was yummy.  i also got their chicken red curry dish (#22) and that was not good.  also tried the ginger prawn and mushroom dish (#20) and that was nice.
author: Melissa Y.

description: One of our 'finds' in the mission - food is some of the most flavorful Thai around.  The chicken in the curry is nicely marinated, tender and dee-licious.  Decor is not 'destination' quality, so we do take-out.  Frequently.
author: Dan C.

description: This is the closest Thai place to my house and I feel quite lucky about that.  I love their shrimp with green curry.  Another delicious option is the Tom Ka Gai soup, but there are inedibles in that soup, so be careful while you eat.  I know that the inedibles make the soup yummier, but I always end up munching on some whole lemongrass and leaves.  The service, however, is excellent and quick.  I don't go here once a week for nothing.
author: Jody S.

description: So i decided to try this place because of the good reviews on here but stick to the foods that got those reviews. I was a bit disappointed  but the food was decent but not great. BBQ chicken looked and tasted more like it was fried but was OK. When I want Thai BBQ chicken i expect it to be BBQd  not fried but who knows right. Rice dish and soup was good. Chicken Satay was OK at best but the peanut sauce was good. I will probably eat here again and try the pad thai people seem to like that
author: Michael K.

description: The food was solid and the service was good. The duck salad was yummy, but the beef curry was only so-so.
author: Christy C.

description: I've been here twice and I'm a fan of the food.  It's also reasonably priced (and close to me!).  The Pad Thai and Yellow Chicken Curry are very tasty.
author: Akshay S.

description: Had this for lunch one day because it's close to work.  Not remarkable in any way.  Had the pad thai, which was fine although for the price I can think of a zillion other places that would be much tastier.  Not awful, just not worth it.
author: Amber M.

description: A Thai restaurant in this part of the Mission and of this quality is a great surprise.   The food is good and consistent.   A plus is that it's usually queit and not crowded evenings when the bulk of the SF General crowd has gone home.  And where else in this neighborhood could you get a Singh beer to go with your calamari and snow peas?
author: Gregg B.

description: Really tasty tai food and relaxing atmosphere.  I really dig this place because sometimes it is nice to walk into a place that is quiet and peacful.  The food is great and goes well with a cold asian beer.  Good place for food and conversation.
author: Patrick T.

description: wow.  inexpensive, super tasty, well-cooked thai food.  great atmosphere, really laidback and friendly staff.  there are a lot of vegetarian and vegan options, such as gang jae (veggie curry with mock duck) and pad thai jae.  their pad thai is seriously the best i've ever had.  and they will adapt orders for you :)
author: emma d.

description:
staff=nice
ambiance=out of place
food=mediocre
overall=overrated
author: Jaakko P.

description: I went here 4 years ago when I first moved nearby but hadn't been back for some reason.  Now with friends in town we needed some take out and I took other Yelp reviews to heart and decided this was the place.  Everything we ordered was delicious, the Satay, Beef Salad, Pad Thai, Duck, Chicken with Ginger and Mushrooms, and a little more.  Only negative is the difficulty in parking and the fact that it often looks closed (though it isn't).
author: Matt C.

description: We had a good experience here.  The food was quite good although the service was a bit slow.  I especially appreciated that the vegetables weren't cooked to death.
author: W R.

description: we've eaten here a few times and really wanted to like it as it was recommended to us by someone whom had recently returned from thailand, and said this was the 'most authentic' thai food in the city....we've never been to thailand, but we thought it tasted like every other thai restaurant we had been to...mediocre at best...the pad thai was ok, and the green curry was ok too...very small portions and the people that work there are extremely rude.  they make you feel like you are putting them out for coming into eat.  there are TWO tvs in the restaurant, both for the people that work there...they watch TV the entire time..we are definitely not in a hurry to come back...
author: lc m.

description: omg the food is so delicious... i had to marry in the family... now i get to eat all food on the menu plus many more custom dishes in the kitchen for freeeeee! how great is that? hahaha too bad you guys cant get it for free like me... but hey its not like the food is expensive or anything... best thai food in northern cali for the cheapest price hands down!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
author: Bao N.
